intro: Senecio virgatus, commonly known as the silverleaf groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its silver-gray foliage, which is covered in fine, dense hairs. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. Senecio virgatus is a hardy perennial that is relatively drought-tolerant once established.
